title: Chrysler Beats Most Of Power Module Defect Suit
content:
,  1:46 PM ET) -- A New York federal judge gutted a proposed class action accusing Chrysler Group LLC of concealing a power module defect in its vehicles, ruling on Monday that about two-thirds of their multistate claims lack sufficiently detailed factual allegations. 
U.S. District Judge Katherine B. Forrest identified a number of flaws in the 38 claims brought by 10 plaintiffs across nine states over an allegedly defective module that serves as a vehicle's electronic nerve center, including several plaintiffs’ failure to adequately plead a manufacturing defect that would be...
